block.p: Tribute to firefighters and police officers. Representative Lynn Woolsey of California on American success stories. Lydia Camarillo, the chief executive of the convention. Terry McAuliffe, the chairman of the convention committee. Secretary of Labor Alexis M. Herman Gov. Jeanne Shaheen of New Hampshire Gov. Gary Locke of Washington Tribute to former President Jimmy Carter Comments from United States Senators Barbara A. Mikulski of Maryland, Barbara Boxer of California, Dianne Feinstein of California, Mary L. Landrieu of Louisiana, Blanche Lincoln of Arkansas and Patty Murray of Washington. Also speaking will be Representative Debbie Stabenow, who is seeking a Senate seat from Michigan. Remarks by Hillary Rodham Clinton. Address by President Clinton. Musical performance Benediction

Tribute to firefighters and police officers. Representative Lynn Woolsey of California on American success stories. Lydia Camarillo, the chief executive of the convention. Terry McAuliffe, the chairman of the convention committee. Secretary of Labor Alexis M. Herman Gov. Jeanne Shaheen of New Hampshire Gov. Gary Locke of Washington Tribute to former President Jimmy Carter Comments from United States Senators Barbara A. Mikulski of Maryland, Barbara Boxer of California, Dianne Feinstein of California, Mary L. Landrieu of Louisiana, Blanche Lincoln of Arkansas and Patty Murray of Washington. Also speaking will be Representative Debbie Stabenow, who is seeking a Senate seat from Michigan. Remarks by Hillary Rodham Clinton. Address by President Clinton. Musical performance Benediction

ABC (Channel 7 in New York) 10 p.m. to 11 p.m. CBS (Channel 2 in New York) 10 p.m. to 11 p.m. live coverage on ''48 Hours'' CNN 7 p.m. to 11 p.m. -- live coverage 11 p.m. to midnight -- postconvention wrap-up FOX (Channel 5 in New York) No special coverage FOX NEWS CHANNEL 8 p.m. to 11 p.m. -- live coverage Midnight to 1 a.m. -- convention wrap-up MSNBC 5 p.m. to 1 a.m. -- live coverage NBC (Channel 4 in New York) 10:30 p.m. to 11 p.m. live coverage with Tom Brokaw and Tim Russert PBS (Channel 13 in New York) 8 p.m. to past 11 p.m. -- Jim Lehrer will interview Bill Bradley, then live coverage
COMEDY CENTRAL 11 p.m. to 11:30 p.m. -- ''Daily Show With Jon Stewart'' C-SPAN Live gavel to gavel convention coverage
Party Sites www.dems2000.com www.algore2000.com www.democrats.org www.dscc.org www.dccc.org www.democraticgovernors.org

Many major news organizations are planning to use live video from the television pool coverage by C-Span on their Web sites that will be the same as that broadcast by the television networks. Other Web-based news sites will provide similar coverage and NationalJournal.com, which is normally open only to subscribers, will have open access during the conventions and provide a guide to convention news on the Web. In addition, America Online will offer video from the convention hall 24 hours a day, while ''Choose or Loose'' on mtv.com will offer the latest video from MTV News.
''Political Points,'' a live Webcast produced jointly by The New York Times and ABC News, can be viewed daily at 1:30 p.m. and 8 p.m. Eastern time at: www.nytimes.com/politics abcnews.go.com

Additional coverage is available at both sites, including past Webcasts and, via C-Span, live gavel-to-gavel floor proceedings. In addition, Yahoo will offer a daily Webcast at 2:20 p.m. featuring columnists from The New York Times and members of its editorial board.
